title: Isabelle M. Gibson
text:
Biography
I am a Government and Politics Ph.D. student at the University of Maryland. I study American Politics, my research interests are American behavior, race and ethnic politics, political psychology and political media. I earned my B.A. in Political Science at Washington State University in 2022, double majored in Political Science and Philosophy.

Areas of Interest

Political Media and Communication
Black Politics
Race and Ethnic Politics


CV:



Degrees

B.A. - Political Science, Washington State University 2022



Awards

2021-05-07
CAS Summer 2021 Undergraduate Research, Scholarship, or Creativity Activity Support - Washington State University
2021-12-15
CAS Spring 2022 Undergraduate Research, Scholarship, or Creativity Activity Support - Washington State University



Conferences

2024
APSA 2024 Annual Meeting and Exhibition, Philadelphia, PA
2022
Washington State University, Pullman, WA Showcase for Undergraduate Research and Creative Activities (SURCA)

title: Research
text:
Revealing the Scope of the Smaller Donor Revolution: Rising Activism in U.S. State Politics. With James G. Gimpel



Washington State University

Spring 2022 CAS Undergraduate Research Grant Pullman, WA Undergraduate Research, Scholarship, or Creative Activity Support Award ($2,300)

Conducted survey experiment, Evaluating New Media Consumption and Clarity over the spring of 2022 with 1,200 respondents
Conduct data analysis and draw conclusions from survey data

Summer 2021 CAS Undergraduate Research Grant Pullman, WA Dick Miyagishima Student Support Scholarship in the Liberal Arts ($2,000)

Conducted a pilot survey experiment, Evaluating New Media Consumption and Clarity over the summer of 2021 through the fall of 2021 with 400 respondents nationwide
Conduct data analysis and draw conclusions from survey data
